urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

Anything less than a lengthy prison sentence for this will be an absolute disgrace. Utterly, utterly shameful. I'm literally seething. #wildlifecrime #ecocide #environment #nature #biodiversity @ChrisGPackham @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency https://t.co/ifIbLCUj9c

tweets.text:
BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t
We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAgency and @ForestryComm to take immediate action. https://t.co/27DINp3vD7
On 04/12/20 at 10:45 the river level was 1.33m and above its typical range.

@AllonewordMike @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency @WestBerkshire Hello Mike. We are looking at all enforcement options on the Lambourn case, prosecution is one. It‚Äôs a criminal investigation, so we can‚Äôt say too much right now, but it‚Äôs not about being unable to take action. Thanks for your concern about both incidents, which we share. Peter
River Lugg in severe flood. Hoping it doesn't reach me but sadly the cottages by the river bridge are flooding #kingsland  #Herefordshire  #StormDennis https://t.co/SQ5gDJGMkD

What a mess. #RiverLugg #Herefordshire 
Environmental vandalism
@NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK 
Wildlife habitat destroyed nature erased.
Downstream flooding risk, erosion and mud deposition risks greatly increased
Fish spawning areas obliterated
SSSI seriously damaged https://t.co/jYUlV74vLw
@Feargal_Sharkey @bettwsresident @WUFoundation @EnvAgencyMids Same here Feargal, just getting the live show.
@bbchw @EnvAgencyMids @HerefordshireWT Does anybody know why it was done? We know somebody did it but there must be a reason as to why.

@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Dredging and dumping have been carried out on the heavily protected R Lambourn in @WestBerkshire. Culprits apparently known. @EnvAgency seems unable to get prosecution. They know this govt doesn‚Äôt give a damn.

Outdated flood sirens in Grimsby and Cleethorpes will not be used from 31 December.

Instead, the Flood Warning Service reaches more people with better information and is the best way to stay alert. Sign up https://t.co/SAcXCYjoCa

Read more https://t.co/apYdmzTrnS #Lincolnshire https://t.co/HpRrLAgbWu

@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm And hopefully planning some emergency strategies for residents and properties downstream (see video). A disaster waiting to happen if flooding occurs again https://t.co/pgp3MMIfek

@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency In defence of the local farmer, but parts of the River Lugg in Herefordshire have been flooded almost continuously.
#r4today https://t.co/KQBVdXPNXC
Congratulations @WestCumbriaRT @EnvAgencyNW great work üëè https://t.co/hUQrbkZzoe

... valuable *and bio-diverse* environments ..

@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm If this type of blatant destruction (with bulldozer!!) slipped through the net of all the statutory bodies set up precisely to protect such valuable io diverse environment, what other such destruction is passing you by?
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm How long ago was the @EnvAgency aware that this was going on?
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Can you confirm exactly when the @EnvAgency were informed about this incident?

Take a look at flooding at exact site early this year (see video) When the land floods now massive soil erosion, landowner will lose land, people downstream could be inundated with mud. @EnvAgency need to prepare now!! #RiverLugg #Herefordshire 3/3 https://t.co/CcLkHBcwGP

.@EnvAgencyMids is calling for those responsible for stripping away trees from a mile of the River Lugg to be prosecuted. 
@HerefordshireWT says decades of damage has been done, destroying an important habitat for fish, birds and mammals. https://t.co/8NHPrlu2m9
@ChelseyMcGY that's a great gif, and exactly the right face to pull at some suggestions we all often get I reckon! Better to smile like that than explode with a 'Don't you know who I am!' :)
@CraigBennett3 @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts I still can't see reference to the reason why the work was carried out. It can't be totally without rationale, can it?
This runoff smells of sewage and comes from a area full of dead plants @AnglianWater @DefraWater https://t.co/vAKOs2UiDK
